thread.title: Lady Hornets picked to win MIAA
thread.title_full: Lady Hornets picked to win MIAA

author: The Emporia Gazette
title: Lady Hornets picked to win MIAA
text:
The Associated Press Kelsey Barnwell 
Emporia State's Kelsey Barnwell (4) pulls up for a shot in front of Emma Mahady (2), of Califorina (Pa.), during a NCAA Division II Women's Basketball Championship Tournament semifinal game on Wednesday, March 25, 2015, at the Sanford Pentagon in Sioux Falls, S.D. Posted: Friday, October 23, 2015 9:14 am | Updated: 9:23 am, Fri Oct 23, 2015. Lady Hornets picked to win MIAA The Emporia Gazette emporiagazette.com | 0 comments 
The Emporia State women’s basketball team received an expected No. 1 position in the MIAA’s Preseason Coaches Poll, released Thursday. The ESU men were picked 11th. 
The Lady Hornets received the maximum 13 first-place votes, as a coach can’t vote for his or her own team, following a No. 1 national ranking they received by DII Bulletin. 
ESU brings back four starters, including MIAA Freshman of the Year Addie Lackey and First Team All-MIAA guard Kelly Moten, from the 2014-15 season that ended in the Final Four. 
The Lady Hornets take on the University of Kansas in an exhibition on Nov. 8 in Lawrence. ESU opens its regular season Nov. 13 at Southwestern Oklahoma. 
Fort Hays State was slated second in the women’s poll, receiving the only other first-place vote, while Central Missouri was picked third ahead of Pittsburg State. 
In the men’s poll, Northwest Missouri was tabbed No. 1 in the conference, though five teams received a first-place vote. Nine votes separated second (Central Missouri) and fifth (Pittsburg State), with ESU’s 58 trailing Washburn (72) and Missouri Western in a tie for ninth. 
The Hornets return their top six scorers from 2014-15, which saw them finish with a 12-16 record and missing the MIAA Tournament. ESU added a collection of transfers, with two listed at 6-foot-11 (Kevin Allen, Boise State) and 7-foot (Bradley Fisher, Montana State). 
MIAA Women’s Preseason Coaches Poll 
1. Emporia State (13)...169 
2. Fort Hays State (1)...147 
3. Central Missouri 135
